localizedDescriptions.en: An order or instruction for a health-related therapy or activity to be carried out.
Current Activity.
The name of the single therapy or activity requested.

annotations.comment: Coding of the 'Activity name' with a coding system is desirable, if available. For example: 'recommendation to rest in bed'; 'apply ice for 20 minutes every 2 hours'.

children.name: Terapi ke

localizedDescriptions.en: The date/time, or acceptable interval of date/time, for provision of the therapy.

annotations.comment: This data element allows for recording of the timing for a single therapy, either as a date and time, a date ranges or a text descriptor which can allow for 'next available. In practice, clinicians will often think in terms of ordering therapys as approximate timing, for example: review in 3 months, 6 months or 12 months. As clinical systems need more exact parameters to operate on, this '3 months' will usually be converted to an exact date 3 months from the date of recording and stored using this data element. If complex timing or sequences of timings are required, use the CLUSTER.service_direction archetype within the 'Complex timing' SLOT and this data element becomes redundant.

localizedDescriptions.en: A framework for the clinical classification and stage grouping of malignancies using the TNM system.

annotations.comment: Designated as TNM or cTNM.

localizedDescriptions.en: The anatomical site where the assessed tumour is situated.

annotations.comment: Use the value from the TNM variant for each type of cancer. For example: stomach; or small intestine.

children.name: Tanggal Kemoterapi sesuai jadwal

localizedDescriptions.en: The date/time that marks the beginning of the valid period of time for delivery of this activity.

annotations.comment: This date/time is the equivalent to the earliest possible date for carrying out the activity. For example: sometimes a certain amount of time must pass before an activity can be carried out. For example: 'start mobilisation 2 days post surgery'.

The name of the single therapy or activity requested.

annotations.comment: Coding of the 'Activity name' with a coding system is desirable, if available. For example: 'recommendation to rest in bed'; 'apply ice for 20 minutes every 2 hours'.

localizedDescriptions.en: Category of therapy or activity ordered.

annotations.comment: Coding of the 'Activity type' with a coding system is desirable, if available. If the 'Therapy name' was coded, it is possible for this data point to be derived from the code. For example: 'Self-care intervention'.

localizedDescriptions.en: Summary information about the death of an individual, excluding the cause(s) of death.
Context or setting of the death.

annotations.comment: It is recommended that 'Manner of death' be coded with an external terminology.

localizedDescriptions.en: Death demographic data
The date of death of a person

children.name: Sumber Status Vital atau Metode Kontak
children.localizedName: Sumber Status Vital atau Metode Kontak

localizedNames.en: Sumber Status Vital atau Metode Kontak

localizedDescriptions.en: Indicates the source of information about a subject of cares death. This field provides an indication of the certainty of the information
Death additional demographic data
The country where a person  died
The city/town/locality where a person died
An individual human being.
Details about the location of a person, physical building or landmark.
An unstructured address line representing all relevant street-level or post-box details that would support the identification of a location.

annotations.comment: Occurrences for this data element is set to 0..* to allow one or more free text 'Address line' data elements to represent the huge variety of ways that street-level' details may need to be recorded within the context of a specified 'Town'. Multiple address lines can be represented in a template, renamed as 'Address line 1', 'Address line 2,' etc. For example: '7A/52 Davis Street' or 'Apartment 7A' as Address line 1 with '52 Davis Street' as Address line 2; a roadside mail box location, such as 'RMB 725, Princes Highway'; or using a descriptive landmark, such as or 'Corner of Smith & Brown Streets' or 'Second house north of the general store with the red door'.

localizedDescriptions.en: The name of the suburb, town, city, village, community or lowest level locality that contains the address.

annotations.comment: Coding with an external terminology is preferred, where possible. For example: 'Fitzroy'; 'Manchester'; 'Kingston' or 'Bergen'.

localizedDescriptions.en: The name of a local government district or geographical area that contains the address.

annotations.comment: Coding with an external terminology is preferred, where possible. For example: 'Surf Coast' and 'Yarra' local government councils in Victoria, Australia; and the Counties of 'Cornwall', 'Middlesex' & 'Surrey' in Jamaica.

localizedDescriptions.en: The name of a major government district or geographical area that contains the address.

annotations.comment: Coding with an external terminology is preferred, where possible. For example: 'New South Wales' and 'Queensland' in Australia; 'British Columbia' and 'Nova Scotia' in Canada; and the Parishes of 'St. Andrew' and 'Kingston' in Jamaica.

localizedDescriptions.en: The code for a postal delivery area containing the address, as defined by the relevant postal delivery service.

annotations.comment: Also known as a postcode or ZIP code.

localizedDescriptions.en: The name of the country containing the address.

annotations.comment: For example: Australia; Canada; Jamaica; or Norway. Coding with an external terminology, such as EN ISO 31661 Alpha 2 country code, is recommended.

localizedDescriptions.en: Details about a specified type of electronic communication.
The unique combination of alphanumeric characters, relevant for representation of 'Type'.

annotations.comment: For example: area code + landline phone/pager number; country code + mobile phone number; or email address.

localizedDescriptions.en: The unique combination of alphanumeric characters, relevant for representation of 'Type'.
The unique combination of alphanumeric characters, relevant for representation of 'Type'.
Details about a specified type of electronic communication.
The unique combination of alphanumeric characters, relevant for representation of 'Type'.

annotations.comment: For example: area code + landline phone/pager number; country code + mobile phone number; or email address.

localizedDescriptions.en: The unique combination of alphanumeric characters, relevant for representation of 'Type'.
The unique combination of alphanumeric characters, relevant for representation of 'Type'.
Additional narrative about the death, not captured in other fields.

annotations.comment: For example: Recording the degree of certainty for place of death.
